values.alignmentText: Greece's .NET market is modest; local roles are sparse, but remote/EU-based gigs exist in Athens/Thessaloniki with modest wages.
Greece pay for 2D Environmental Artist trails top hubs by ~25–30%; lower living costs and strong healthcare offset relocation costs.

Greece's local pool for a 2D Environmental Artist is small; studios rely on remote/imported talent, slowing hires.

Greece's democracy remains healthy under EU oversight; independent judiciary and media with ongoing reforms to monitor.

Greece's job market is mixed: tourism swings and growing tech; occasional layoffs require flexibility or retraining; remote work helps.

Greece's prisons show EU-backed reforms. Overcrowding and uneven resources persist in some facilities.

Greek coffee culture, football passion, sailing along the Aegean, and hiking trails suit a family-friendly pace.

Greece offers universal healthcare and local wellness programs. Active community life exists, though you may need to seek like-minded groups for motivation.

In Greece (GR), family life is workable but requires effort; universal healthcare helps, parks exist, yet bureaucracy can slow daily tasks.

Greece offers modest family benefits (child allowances, childcare subsidies). Bureaucracy remains burdensome, so many costs stay private.
Greece restricts cash benefits for visa families; most regular support requires long-term residency, with limited emergency options.

Greek fashion, especially in Athens, is vibrant and diverse; women can express modern style while workplaces keep modest/formal options.
In Greece urban areas, Greek men blend modern styles with Mediterranean ease; Athens startups favor smart-casual, suburbs stay classic.
In Greece, urban centers offer gender autonomy and family-friendly policies. Yet media still tends to amplify conventional beauty norms.
Greece enforces strict gun laws with low ownership; firearms are rare, so exposure is minimal and the environment feels safe.

Greece's island coastlines, olive groves, and mountain trails offer abundant family-friendly nature outings; Kalymnos and Crete offer rock climbing.

Greece shows moderate obesity levels; public health campaigns and the Mediterranean lifestyle help stabilize rates.

In Greece, perceived corruption is systemic (clientelism and slow courts). For a family, that can slow everyday bureaucratic steps.
In Greece, closer personal space is common in crowds; gently set boundaries for comfort, especially with kids, amid warm social norms.
In Greece, greetings are close (handshakes/cheek kisses) and spaces can be crowded; we’ll steer interactions politely when boundaries are needed.
Greece: mild springs and falls; summers hot but dry. Outdoor life works best March–May and September–October, with coastal areas easing humidity.
Greece's parliamentary democracy with PR and active civil society aligns with your values; expect robust civic engagement, with occasional partisan gridlock.

Greece offers abundant fresh markets and Mediterranean staples; ultra-processed options exist but are balanced by real produce and home cooking.
Greece (GR): PMM (Games) pay trails top markets by ~25–30%; lifestyle offsets help, but remote/hybrid options may be needed.

values.key: Product Marketing Manager (Games): Continuing Education Availability
values.alignmentText: Greece offers sporadic games-marketing training. Occasional conferences/bootcamps and online courses exist, with English options varying.

values.alignmentText: Greece has several universities offering marketing/IT programs. Dedicated games PMM programs are limited, but studio partnerships help supply graduates.

Greece startups often hybrid; remote work is common with periodic on-site days, supporting family-friendly, flexible schedules.

In Greece (Athens/Thessaloniki), Ruby roles exist but cluster in a few startups; remote work is common, so steady networking helps.
Greece is generally safe; low violent crime. Expect pickpocketing in tourist zones and occasional protests; exercise caution after dark.

Most months in Greece are 22–26°C; shoulder seasons may need light rash guards for kids.
Greece's Mediterranean climate yields hot, dry summers and mild winters; expect a couple of seasonal extremes that require cooling and contingency plans.

Greece has a lean senior tech pool; startups often hire from abroad or remote. Athens/Thessaloniki show momentum but talent depth remains limited.
In Greece (GR), urban areas like Athens are liberal about sexuality, while smaller towns remain more conservative; aligns with sex-positive family values.
Greece offers universal healthcare and family benefits, but access can be bureaucratic and funding uneven; strongest core safety nets, with regional gaps.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: In Greece's Athens metro, 2k sq ft rentals exist but are not common; expect broker help, premium rents, and a few weeks of search.
Greece spring hovers ~13–23°C (55–73°F) with breezy, low-humidity days; mild, park-friendly weather for kids, with occasional light showers.
Greece is generally stable with a resilient democracy; occasional regional tensions (Turkey) and debt concerns may affect planning.
Greece (GR) maintains EU-aligned democracy with pluralism and rights protections; policy debates span coalition politics, tourism/tech, and reforms.
In Greece, the system oscillates between deregulation and state control, creating uncertainty for entrepreneurs and families seeking stable growth.
Athens anchors a growing Greek studio scene. Density is moderate, with a few indie and mid-sized game/animation studios.
Greece summers typically hover around 30°C with dry heat and mild evenings; heatwaves to ~38°C can occur, but humidity stays moderate.
Greece generally offers warm, people-first service. In Athens, initiating small talk tends to yield friendly responses, and English is widely understood.
Greece offers modest game tax relief; strongest incentives are for film/audiovisual, with few clear, accessible game-specific programs.
In Greece (GR), long-stay permits typically take 4–9 months; expect a few hundred euros per adult plus translation costs.
Trust in Greece's government is damaged. Misinformation fills the gaps amid ongoing corruption concerns.
Petty and some grand corruption affect permits and contracts in Greece; EU reforms help, but occasional delays and red tape remain.
Senior software pay in Athens, Greece is decent but trails global hubs. Remote U.S. contracts help meet family costs.

Greek schools end around 13:00-14:00; after-school programs help with care. With remote/hybrid work, most days align; occasional late pickups needed.
Greece provides at least 25 paid vacation days after one year, plus public holidays, supporting family travel windows.

Greece has niche VFX/animation programs in Athens and Thessaloniki; pipelines exist but are small, often needing on-the-job upskilling.
VFX Real-Time hiring in Greece often relies on remote/imported talent. Local pipelines are shallow; plan for longer searches.
Across Greece, VFX real-time talent is mixed; roughly half use Greek professionally. English teams may require screening for international work.

VFX real-time talent in Greece is limited; mostly mid-level. Senior hires likely require relocation or remote work; Athens has a few studios.
Greece-Turkey tensions color discourse; North Macedonia is generally cooperative; regional sentiment remains cautious for relocations.
Greece blends proud heritage with EU membership; public life favors pluralism and dialogue, though debates can flare.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries
values.alignmentText: Greece is viewed as cooperative by EU partners, yet fiscally fragile; Turkey's wary stance keeps regional sentiment cautious for families.
In Greece (GR), multiple visa routes suit your family: Golden Visa (€250k real estate), Digital Nomad for remote earners, and financially independent permits.
Walkability in Greece varies; some neighborhoods are walkable with decent transit. Many areas rely on cars and require caution with kids on busy streets.
Greece is generally friendly to US migrants, especially in urban areas like Athens; expect bureaucracy and language hurdles.
Ancient sites, modern Greek creativity in Athens, and island-hopping offer rich, kid-friendly learning for a curious family.
In Greece, coastal winters hover around 7–15°C (45–59°F). Deep freezes are rare, matching your mild-winter preference.
Greece's standard workweek is 40 hours, with occasional overtime to 42-45 hours in some sectors. This supports a family-friendly balance in GR.
Greece's EU tech scene offers flexible hours and recovery time; remote/hybrid options support Sarah's slower, family-friendly pace.
Greece (GR) has EU labor protections (overtime/leave), but enforcement varies; unions exist, yet gig/contract gaps remain.
